Pre-Game Insights: Seth Johnson makes his major league debut as the Philadelphia Phillies face the Miami Marlins.
Phillies-Marlins Projected Starters: Seth Johnson vs. Max Meyer.
Seth Johnson (0-0) with a 0.00 ERA is making his first start in the majors. He is 2-0 in three starts with a .56 ERA in AAA.
Max Meyer (3-5) with a 7.94 ERA and a 1.42 WHIP. Meyer went 5.2 innings in his last start, giving up nine hits, a walk, and two home runs. He would give up five runs in a loss to the Nationals.
The Phillies are sixth in majors in runs scored while sitting fourth in batting average, fifth in on-base percentage, and seventh in slugging.
Alec Bohm is hitting .290 this year with a .343 on-base percentage. He has 13 home runs and 89 RBIs while scoring 59 runs this year. He is considered day-to-day with a hand injury.
Bryce Harper is hitting .280 on the year with a .371 on-base percentage. Harper has 26 home runs, 76 RBIS and 73 runs scored this year.
Kyle Schwarber is hitting .247 with a .370 on-base percentage. Schwarber has 32 home runs, 89 RBIs, and has scored 93 times on the year.
Schwarber has hit .346 with a .393 on-base percentage in the last week. He has four home runs, seven RBIs, and five runs scored.
Kody Clemens is hitting .273 in the last week with a home run, five RBIs, and four runs scored.
Bryson Stott is hitting .285 in the last week with two home runs, four RBIs, and three runs scored.
The Phillies are hitting .249 in the last week with 11 home runs, and 26 RBIs.

Current Phillies have 12 career at-bats against Max Meyer. They have hit .333 against him. J.T. Realmuto is two for three with a double, a home run, and two RBIs. Both Nick Castellanos and Bryston Stott are 1-2 with a double.
The Marlins are 29th in the majors in runs scored, while sitting 19th in batting average, 29th in on-base percentage, and 26th in slugging.
Jake Burger is hitting .247 on the year with a .303 on-base percentage. He has 25 home runs and 60 RBIs. Burger has 59 runs scored as well.
Jesus Sanchez is hitting .246 on the year with a .301 on-base percentage. He has 17 home runs and 58 RBIs. Sanchez has also stolen 12 bases and scored 46 times this year.
Otto Lopez is hitting .241 with year with three home runs and 27 RBIs. He has stolen 16 bases and scored 34 times on the year.
Nick Fortes has been hitting .412 in the last week, scoring two RBIs and three runs.
Griffin Conine is hitting .308 with some runs, two RBIS, and four runs scored.
Jesus Sanchez is hitting .545 in the last week, with two RBIs and a run scored.
The Marlins are hitting .215 in the last week with three home runs and 20 runs scored in six games.
